content.description: A couple of bouldery moves lead to the first bolt. Continue up past a never-ending onslaught of overhangs. The climbing finally eases up as you near the anchors.
content.location: Starts on a ledge that forks off from the trail just before you get to Spawn and Shadowhawk. This is the right-most route on the ledge.

content.description: AKA Nasty's Wild Ride. This climb has a sustained face and a "crash-endo" throw at the top.

Clamber up a large hunk of rock at the base of the wall to reach your first clip, and the start of the 5th-class climbing. Weave your way up the intimidating, overhanging face. Gloriously exposed, with a great view of the creek.
content.location: The tall section of wall immediately before the wire hand-line leading into the Solstice Cave. Spawn goes straight up the middle of the face.

content.description: Climb up a large hunk of rock, then up the arete past an overhang. Continue up the arete to anchors near the top. Tall and exposed, it shares the same great view as Spawn.
content.location: Just right of Spawn, on the arete you pass under when you come to the wire hand-line leading to the Solstice Cave.

content.description: Bouldery start with a thin layback crux in the middle on a beautiful, white sandstone face. Another great route on the Image Wall that deserves way more stars than the Dixie Cragger's Atlas suggests.
content.location: Located two routes left of Spawn.

content.description: A delicate face allows passage to the tiers up top.
Pull an easy overhanging boulder problem onto a perfect slightly over hanging face and run for the chains.  This one is pumpy for how short it is.
content.protection: Bolts. Lots of bolts.  Watch out for the Z-clip on this one.  Two bolt anchor on the ledge above.
content.location: On the far left side of the main section of Image Wall.  To the left of "Prophet .11b" and to the right around the corner from "Super Final .12b"

content.description: Slabby face climbing leads to a steeper face, and anchors.
content.location: Left end of the Image Wall, to the right of Backlash. Start just right of a right-facing dihedral.

content.description: Mellow face climbing leads straight up to the anchors.
content.protection: 7 bolts, shares anchors with Comic Relief Left
content.location: On the face, to the right of Comic Relief Left.

content.description: A sport route that also makes a good beginner trad lead. Climb the face just left of the corner/crack to meet up with the corner. Continue up the corner past a steep section, then out the right face of the corner to anchors.
content.protection:
sport: 6 bolts, anchors 

  trad: light rack, hands to fingers, anchors
content.location: Starts in a left-facing corner, to the right of the Comic Reliefs and Pit.

content.description:
A really nice line that saves its hardest moves for the last.  The roof crux move requires a long reach and good footwork. 

  Starting where a tree leans almost into the cliff, climb the face on good holds to a small roof, well protected by a bolt.  Pull the roof and make the final face moves to the top.
content.location: The first route in the Image Wall area; starts about 10' left of Comic Relief Left.  Rap from bolted anchors.

content.description: This is the first wall you come to after the steep descent.
